about.summary: The ability to tune models is important. 'tune' contains functions and classes to be used in conjunction with other 'tidymodels' packages for finding reasonable values of hyper-parameters in models, pre-processing methods, and post-processing steps.

name: r-tune
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-tune
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/tune_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/tune/tune_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 107d0d273b61f8276f5d8991c3c7f0af7123de9c6207288f036d4140e76f3176

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-gpfit
    - r-cli >=2.0.0
    - r-crayon
    - r-dials >=0.0.4
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.3
    - r-foreach
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-glue
    - r-hardhat >=0.1.0
    - r-parsnip >=0.0.4
    - r-purrr >=0.3.2
    - r-recipes >=0.1.9
    - r-rlang >=0.4.0
    - r-rsample
    - r-tibble >=2.1.3
    - r-tidyr
    - r-workflows >=0.1.0
    - r-yardstick
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-gpfit
    - r-cli >=2.0.0
    - r-crayon
    - r-dials >=0.0.4
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.3
    - r-foreach
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-glue
    - r-hardhat >=0.1.0
    - r-parsnip >=0.0.4
    - r-purrr >=0.3.2
    - r-recipes >=0.1.9
    - r-rlang >=0.4.0
    - r-rsample
    - r-tibble >=2.1.3
    - r-tidyr
    - r-workflows >=0.1.0
    - r-yardstick

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('tune')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('tune')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/tidymodels/tune
  license: MIT
  summary: The ability to tune models is important. 'tune' contains functions and classes to be used in conjunction with other 'tidymodels' packages for finding reasonable
    values of hyper-parameters in models, pre-processing methods, and post-processing steps.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: tune
# Title: Tidy Tuning Tools
# Version: 0.0.1
# Authors@R: c( person(given = "Max", family = "Kuhn", email = "max@rstudio.com", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("RStudio", role = "cph"))
# Description: The ability to tune models is important. 'tune' contains functions and classes to be used in conjunction with other 'tidymodels' packages for finding reasonable values of hyper-parameters in models, pre-processing methods, and post-processing steps.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# URL: https://github.com/tidymodels/tune
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: dplyr (>= 0.8.3), rlang (>= 0.4.0), tibble (>= 2.1.3), purrr (>= 0.3.2), dials (>= 0.0.4), recipes (>= 0.1.9), utils, ggplot2, glue, cli (>= 2.0.0), crayon, yardstick, rsample, tidyr, GPfit, foreach, parsnip (>= 0.0.4), workflows (>= 0.1.0), hardhat (>= 0.1.0)
# Suggests: testthat, knitr, covr, kernlab, xml2, spelling
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.0.2.9000
# Language: en-US
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-02-01 14:42:27 UTC; maxkuhn
# Author: Max Kuhn [aut, cre], RStudio [cph]
# Maintainer: Max Kuhn <max@rstudio.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-02-11 08:50:03 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
